newsitem.title: IRAQ: Explosions and anti-aircraft fire in Baghdad.
newsitem.headline: Explosions and anti-aircraft fire in Baghdad.

text.p: Large explosions were heard in Baghdad on Wednesday evening, along with heavy anti-aircraft fire, witnesses said.
It was not immediately known what caused the explosions.
Reporters in their offices said they heard about a dozen large explosions in Baghdad. The ground was shaking in some areas, a Reuters correspondent said.
The night-sky was lit up with anti-aircraft fire.
The United States launched 17 cruise missiles against what Washington called military targets in southern Iraq on Wednesday morning, after firing 27 cruise missiles on Tuesday.
